Running TestsPublished by Mark Wylde on 2020-06-25

Edit this pageLast updated: 2020-08-10

With the latest commit to the main bitabase repo, you can now bring up an environment and run all the integration tests. This works even on a scaled cluster.

Put your docker instance into swarm mode.

docker swarm init

Download the example docker-compose.yml file:

wget https://github.com/bitabase/bitabase/raw/master/docker-compose.yml

You can now bring up a new swarm stack:

docker stack deploy -c docker-compose.yml up

This will bring up 1 gateway, 1 manager and 1 server along with an rqlite server to connect them.

Alternatively you could download the latest release and just run the executable, but scaling will be a bit more involved as you must setup separate servers for each node.

Next we can run the integration tests.

npm install
node test

All being well, this should run and pass every test.

Now we can scale some services up.

docker service scale bitabase_server=3
docker service scale bitabase_manager=3
docker service scale bitabase_gateway=3

Once again, we can run the tests to confirm everything is working.

node test

And just like that we have a scalable, sharded database cluster. Add new swarm nodes on different VM's and see how far you can scale.
